definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: The separation-type of sound change is one of the sound changes in the Mongolian language.
sentences.chinese: 离散式音变是蒙古语的一种音变现象。

sentences.english: The separation-type of sound change is one of the sound changes in the Mongolian language.
sentences.chinese: 离散式音变是蒙古语的一种音变现象。

sentences.english: All these changes appear in the form of sandhi, and in form of lexical diffusion as well.
sentences.chinese: 其变化既有连续性音变方式，也有词汇扩散方式。

sentences.english: In Gaoyou dialect, the phenomenon of sound change has representativeness in Jiang-huai dialect.
sentences.chinese: 高邮话的音变现象在江淮方言中极具代表性。

definition: reading or phonetic value of a character
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
